definition: home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Pre-Socratic natural Philosopher, member of the Ionian School.
sentences.chinese: 前苏格拉底自然哲学家，伊奥尼亚学派成员。

sentences.english: Philosophers have posed this moral dilemma for decades.
sentences.chinese: 哲学家们提出这样的一个道德两难已经很多年了。

sentences.english: The medical philosopher C. G. Carus suspected this clearly.
sentences.chinese: 医学哲学家，凯鲁斯，清楚地怀疑到这一点。

sentences.english: Ancient Chinese philosophers were born out of sorcery.
sentences.chinese: 中国古代哲学家们起初多信奉巫术。

sentences.english: Starting with Socrates, philosophers have been searching for the eternal verities.
sentences.chinese: 自苏格拉底以降，哲学家一直在追寻永恒的真理。

sentences.english: But   for the philosopher this is never enough.
sentences.chinese: 但对于哲学家而言，这永远不够。

sentences.english: When the city was feeling strong, the quirky philosopher could be tolerated.
sentences.chinese: 当这城市强盛时，他可以容忍这样一个怪异的哲学家。

sentences.english: According to the philosopher Kierkegaard, admiration for someone is like admitting defeat.
sentences.chinese: 据哲学家克尔凯郭尔称，崇拜某人就像承认失败。

sentences.english: and Nietzsche were kings of the aphorism.
sentences.chinese: 和尼采这样的哲学家们是警句之王。

sentences.english: Jikang is a famous philosopher in Wei-jin Period of China.
sentences.chinese: 嵇康是中国古代魏晋时期著名哲学家。

sentences.english: But these men are not philosophers.
Luo Yin was well-known as a poet in the late Tang dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 罗隐在晚唐以诗文名世，其实他也是一位哲学家。

sentences.english: Enlightenment philosophers did not seek merely to interpret the world but to change it.
sentences.chinese: 启蒙运动的哲学家不仅试图解读世界，还试图改变它。

sentences.english: The minister for business affairs is a philosopher.
He is a famous Stoic philosopher.
sentences.chinese: 他是知名的斯多葛学派哲学家。

definition: Baruch or Benedict Spinoza (1632-1677), rationalist philosopher
Georg Wilhelm Friedrich Hegel (1770-1831), German philosopher
Socrates (469-399 BC), Greek philosopher/José Sócrates (1957-), prime minister of Portugal (2005-2011)
